contentrichtext.text: '''Baron Martonmere''', of Blackpool in the County Palatine of Lancaster, is a title in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. It was created in 1964 for the [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative]] politician [[Roland Robinson, 1st Baron Martonmere|Sir Roland Robinson]]. {{As of|2010}} the title is held by his grandson, the second Baron, who succeeded in 1989. He is the eldest son of the Hon. Richard Anthony Gasque Robertson (1935-1979), only son of the first Baron. ==Barons Martonmere (1964)== *[[Roland Robinson, 1st Baron Martonmere|(John) Roland Robinson, 1st Baron Martonmere]] (1907–1989) **Hon. Richard Anthony Gasque Robertson (1935–1979) *John Stephen Robinson, 2nd Baron Martonmere (b. 1963) ==Notes== {{unreferenced|date=February 2013}} {{reflist}} ==References== *Kidd, Charles, Williamson, David (editors). ''Debrett's Peerage and Baronetage'' (1990 edition). New York: St Martin's Press, 1990, {{Page needed |date=February 2013}} *{{Rayment|date=February 2012}} ==External links== *{{Hansard-contribs | mr-john-robinson-2 | John Stephen Robinson, 2nd Baron Martonmere }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Martonmere}} [[Category:Baronies in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]]
